left_section.title: What is the difference between a “static” and “dynamic” website?
left_section.desc: A static website is one that is written in html only. each page is a separate document and there is no database that it draws on, whereas a dynamic website is written using more complex code and can do a lot more.

left_section.title: How much does a website cost?
left_section.desc: This is a common question. But it’s not one we can answer without information about the particulars of what the website needs to be and do such as how large will it be, does it require complex features and functions, and will it be a fairly simple web brochure or an elaborate online store, etc.

left_section.title: How do you know that my new website is working as required?
left_section.desc: We perform a number of pre-launch tests and other processes to make sure that your website is performing as promised and meets industry standards. We test to make sure that your website renders properly in all the major browsers, works properly with all plugins and third party integrations, and loads within acceptable limits.

left_section.title: What if all I need is a makeover of my current website?
left_section.desc: We can certainly do that too. We are committed to addressing the specific needs of each client. Whether it is a brand new website or just an upgrade of one that has become a little outdated.

right_section.title: ​Who owns the website after it's created?
right_section.desc: You do. We provide you with complete handover instructions to manage and edit your website, we will simply manage your domain name renewal (if applicable) and hosting for the life of the website.

right_section.title: ​I already have a domain name, can I use this for my website?
right_section.desc: Yes, no problem at all. We will assist you in ensuring your domain settings point to your new website as part of our web design service.

right_section.title: How long does it take to design a website for my business?
right_section.desc: It varies from website to website based on the requirement. If you have the content for your site written before the design process begins, it will help in completing the project quickly.

right_section.title: What if i change my mind and want to add or change design or features of my website?
right_section.desc: Websites are very flexible. Your website can be changed any time you want. From the text content to the overall design, or adding a new feature to your existing website any time you choose, you can change anytime you want.

left_section.title: What's the difference between UI and UX design?
left_section.desc: UI (User Interface) refers to the aesthetic elements through which the users interact with your application or product. Whereas, UX (User Experience) refers to the experience that a user has with the product or application. UI deals with interaction quality.

section11_heading: Surbhi’s Data Science, AI, ML Services Methodology

left_section.title: ​What is data science?
left_section.desc: Data Science is a field which contains various tools and algorithms for gaining useful insights from raw data. It involves various methods for data modelling and other data related tasks such as data cleansing, preprocessing, analysis, etc.

left_section.title: What is Artificial Intelligence (AI)?
left_section.desc: Artificial intelligence is an area of computer science that emphasizes the creation of intelligent machines that work and react like humans. This specialization is designed to enable students to build intelligent machines with cutting edge combination of machine learning, analytics and visualization technologies.

left_section.title: Why is Artificial Intelligence needed?
left_section.desc: Artificial intelligence is now emerging as a key accelerator of the digital transformation because of the new algorithms are continuously being developed for data utilization, shortage of skilled professionals, globally competitive edge, ethical development, and digitization.

left_section.title: What’s Machine Learning (ML)?
left_section.desc: Machine learning is one of AI’s branches. At a high level, ML is about teaching a computer how to make accurate predictions when it is fed with data.

right_section.title: How much does this cost?
right_section.desc: The cost of data science vary widely depending upon your business requirements. Our data science work is bespoke to your needs and always must provide your company with more value than it costs.

right_section.title: Do you ever mix customer data sets?
right_section.desc: Never.

right_section.title: What benefits can your company get from data science?
right_section.desc: Using data science, your company can gain a variety of financial and business related benefits, based on the short and long term goals of the company.

right_section.title: Does data science have a future ?
right_section.desc: In the past statisticians had to manually design their predictive models and readjust them over and over again. Growing amounts of data and ever more complex business problems make this very difficult without applying the concepts of data science. In this context, data science is here to stay for a very long time.

section10_slider.name: AR/VR Strategy

section10_slider.name: Testing
section10_slider.desc: It is essential to test the VR software to get further improvements. The testing process can involve simulation exercises and prototype testing.

left_section.title: What is Virtual Reality?
left_section.desc: Virtual reality is an artificial environment that is actually created using software and is presented to the user in a way to make him accept it as a real environment. Virtual reality is a simulated experience which can be similar or different from the real world. In simple words virtual reality is creating a virtual environment in such a way that we experience it as if we were physically present there. With the help of VR, users can step into the virtual world.

left_section.title: What is Augmented Reality?
left_section.desc: Augmented reality (AR) is a type of interactive, reality-based display environment that takes the capabilities of computer generated display, sound, text and effects to enhance the user's real-world experience. Augmented reality combines real and computer-based scenes and images to deliver a unified but enhanced view of the world.

left_section.title: How should I evaluate which tech to use: AR, VR, or MR?
left_section.desc: AR overlays virtual objects onto a real-world environment, making it ideal for use cases like remote assistance and replacing on-site meetings because everyone can see the same thing. MR goes one step further by anchoring virtual objects onto the real world. A great example is in complex manufacturing, where assembly instructions can go on top of the machinery and then update throughout the job. VR is a fully immersive digital environment. A top use case is learning and development (L&D) because it allows trainees to experience doing a job in an isolated and risk-free environment. For instance, an operator can learn how to use heavy machinery without having to take the machine off the line and without bringing any risk to either the machine or themselves.

right_section.title: What are the benefits of AR/VR in different business sectors?
right_section.desc: Standalone VR is any VR headset that works completely by itself. In contrast, PC VR is any headset that requires a constant connection to a nearby PC.

right_section.title: Can we have a Proof-of-Concept (PoC) developed before signing the actual project?
right_section.desc: We have expertise in undertaking small projects for developing POCs and providing a demonstration before taking on the actual project for your organization. The POC would be a cost-plus project as considerable expertise and resources need to be invested to produce the POC. In most cases, we waive-off this POC cost from the final invoice of the actual project billing as a token of goodwill.

right_section.title: What is the typical AR/VR development timeline and budget?
right_section.desc: The typical timeline for the development of any AR/VR solution is approximately three (3) months. It also depends on the scope and its performance requirements. The testing and other finishing processes depend on several factor Our goal is to be open and transparent with our clients and always strive to deliver a product or solution at the quickest possible time frame without compromising on our quality and performance standards. Though budgets vary greatly according to final scope, we can give ballparks upon understanding your basic requirements.

right_section.title: ​What are the major variants of VR devices?
right_section.desc: VR technology can be experienced in many ways. It depends on the solution being developed, performance, user interaction, VR content and experience desired in the virtual worlds. Fusion VR understands these requirements and recommends the devices for sustained high performance using this immersive technology. The first is PC powered VR where heavy complex 3D assets and interactions are involved and the required processing happens at PC. The devices in use are typically Oculus Rift and HTC Vive categories. The second type is the Standalone VR which is ideal for watching VR movies and simple gameplay. The processing and storage are internal and the most common devices for such applications are Oculus Quest and Vive Focus categories. The final type is the VR-Box which uses mobile phones that are inserted inside the box like Google cardboard or Samsung Gear VR. Such devices are entry level, that give a basic demonstration of VR experience for the first-timers.
